one_reviews_text: almost fell asleep playing. took less than an hour to lose interest

To start, this game is basically Lone Echo but while driving a space chair (like in the movie Gravity) with a broken joystick and an oxygen canister the size of a water bottle (Not to mention the broken saving system).  The graphics are incredible and the environments realistic, but the constant threat of running out of oxygen and difficulty of controls make it virtually impossible to enjoy these surroundings.  

Pros: 
-Great graphics
-Highly realistic (if frustrating) movement system.  
-Decent story
-Well-built environments

Cons: 
-Extremely difficult movement system
-Horrible resource management system, particularly pertaining to oxygen
-Unnecessarily complicated gameplay mechanics, such as rockets, shielding, boost, etc.
-Extremely limited resources
-Some unintuitive puzzles with no hints
-Lack of enjoyable Oculus Touch controller integration

In fairness, I haven't yet played the game on easy mode.  Perhaps this would solve all of my qualms with the game, but I rather doubt it.  Will update if my opinion on this changes.  
In short, a very good basis for a game ruined by nearly unplayable gameplay mechanics.

First of, I'm not through yet, but I know I'm not far from it from what I've read, so I can already say, it's pretty short, but sweet.
Yes, the locomotion system is intense (Astronaut Difficulty with "point to" movement), but with the movement option I've chosen (which was the default at time of install) it only needs some getting used to with the oculus touch controllers and you're fine afterwards and pretty quickly good to go. Don't know how long this options is available though, because the others are definitley way harder to get used to, so I can understand the problems some people have with it.
At the moment I still can't think of a reason why someone would call it "unplayable" with touch controllers, it really is fine, it still can cause some nausea after some time, but it's really nice made and meant to feel "realistic" to some extend and delivers for my opinion.
Just check it out if you're into Zero-G, if you want something long and easy to digest at the same time, stay away from it, it's no lone echo, but it's fine in it's own right.

It is great fun to fly around in weightlessness. The controls are very difficult at the beginning (but also realistic), but you get used to it after a while. The environment is beautifully designed and has a high quality. The flying/floating is, I think, very realistic (I have never been in real weightlessness before, so I can't say for sure ;) ). So far I like the storyline very much. 
-
I would definitely recommend the game to others, but I would warn those who get sick quickly in VR to think twice.
-
The impressions were created in the most difficult level of difficulty and with a very good PC equipment, therefore on highest quality settings.
-
And to the "Lone Echo is much better" writers:I think that both games are very well done and both have their own individual character.
After reading a bunch of negative reviews, I saw a review recommending using the Xbox controller instead of Touch. Great idea. Movement seems very intuitive with the controller. So far so good.
Your vision is extremly reduced to remove motion sickness, the trade off is you dont see anything and immersion is 0... might as well jump around in your living room pretending to be a cosmonaut
Poor controls ruin this game from the start. Lone Echo shows how to do zero g immersively and intuatively, this game shows how not to do it.
Eh.. another waste of time trying to install a game and windows blocking it

If youre looking for your next Lone Echo fix, you will not find it here.

Don't get me wrong, its not a 1 star game as some people have labeled it, but it is a poor implimentation of 0G movement, needlessly difficult to master.

I'm sure if I took the time to learn its movement mechanics more thoroghly, i'd have a great time, but time is valuable, and will that time spent learning be worth while? who knows.

Graphics, voice acting, and world building are all good. Just cant same much about gameplay, seeing as movement is a challenge in of itself.

An optimistic 3 stars from me.

This game is INTENSE...I can't wait to get further into the experience but what I have played is a brilliant little puzzler.

Unlike what others have said, the controls are VERY intuitive...IF you use an Xbox controller! 

So in summary, play with a controller and bring a barf bag...GREAT FUN !

After the tutorial I was left alone in a module with pretty much everything offline. Found the air lock to space. What should I do first, where should I fly? Something, a blinking light, a voice, a text... But it's better than Adr1ft.
A must-have for the Rift - if you got the stomach for it. This game can cause nausea, but I guess that's the price for being an astronaut! :-)
That game is really immersive but too short....

Nice VR design, very immersive, including zero gravity feelings, nice music. Not for weak stomaches (especially CW/CCW rotating)! You were warned! Need to think a bit to complete mission. Do you wanna feel, what is free space movement in ZG about? Give it a try! This game worths the money, but could be a bit longer...

I spent like 20 seconds in the game but the nausea was untolerable... I have no idea what the game is about because i couldnt get pass the training at start. I dont think im gonna play this again. If i ever do ill update the review. PS thanks the devs for the support email, unfortunatelly it didnt help much with the nausea, especially when you strafe.  Althought i do saw the "intense" game warning i thought i could try it. Maybe this game just isnt for me.

review_title: I Think Lone Echo has a Cousin....
one_reviews_text: The core mechanics of moving around are similiar to those of Lone Echo, and multiple control schemes gives you a wide range of movement capabilties (the VR scheme enables you to use hand motions to control your movement). It can be very easy to get disorientated, so be careful. I wish the controls were not fixed, and could be adjusted to suit your needs (i.e., I am left-handed). If you want to turn off the 'VR Blinders' to help manage motion sickness, reduce the 'Eagle Eye' setting. I have since gotten further into the game, and the feeling of being an astronaut is captured well. A polished experience that reminds me of a cross between Lone Echo and Adr1ft. Bravo!
Little content and nausea
Once again this is just another game that will give you the feeling of nausea.

review_title: Personal weighless navigation at it best
one_reviews_text: Wish it had more levels but the graphics and personal jet pack navigation was fun and immersive.  The level challenges were challenging and fun but not too difficult.  I finished everything only dying a handful of times.  I really felt like I was in space tooling around huge structures, exploring and solving puzzles while avoiding security drones.  Good fun!
Best VR game so far but is really hard to get into the Big Zoe (level 2)...
The game started just fine.  I was able to select the type of game play and go through the Tutorial without a hitch, but once the animation/video finished playing it was stuck "Loading".
game wont even start
Game doesn't start. No support options. Want my money back.

Played through the first 1.5 hours and was running low on oxygen.  Accidentally went outside of the Power Inverter building which updated the checkpoint with my oxygen at 20.  Impossible to continue because now I die within seconds of reloading last checkpoint.  Checkpoint system sucks.  You need to allow saves from anywhere.  Also the inverter room reloads incorrectly and is impossible to complete now.  I have to throw away my 2 hours of work and start from the beginning.

This game is VERY good.  One of the better VR titles.  Its excruciatingly dizzying, especially indoors.  Its a LOT more tolerable once you get out into space.  If you are looking for an intense VR experience, this is it.  A little difficult to know where to go though.

review_title: THIS IS WHAT VR WAS MADE FOR
one_reviews_text:
Great game and the graphics are spot on the game is really polished and the movement is just great if you have played adrift the movement is nearly the same.
Its a little tricky to no where to go at times but at this price its a steal maybe some room for a update or a add-on this is one of the better vr games.
wow beautiful graphics,atmosheric sounds,mental mechanics but not for the weaked stomach first game ever made me feel quizy ever,played for 40 mins so far but very polished
I legit got motion sickness a couple times and had to continue later on, but its an awesome game none the less.
once i get use to the VR but its working out the awesome.
Doesnt even start. waste of 20 bucks..

Something new for me. I don't like games for VR with forced teleport, so I was hyped for Detached. The game has great immersion feeling! I didn't felt motion sickness. Looking forward to try multiplayer mode.

I love total freedom in movement. It was hard to master the steering at the beginning, but in the second space station (with Boost?) I successfully passed speed trap puzzle. Space environment fits the best for this game! Recommended for S-F enthusiasts and beginner astronauts :D
Wow! It's sick game! Looking forward to playing it also with Touch controllers. You guys made the great job with the graphics. And what engine did you use guys? Unreal?

I heard a lot about this game. Definitely this is the game for players with iron stomach. I passed tutorial level without any problems. After getting familiar with the steering my jaw drops, when I went to the open space. AWESOME feeling! For now I'm only trying singleplayer mode. Dunno nothing about multi.
The feeling of space is amazing, but touch this only if you know you can handle intense experiences.
